The Nagant M1887 revolver, an innovative design by Belgian brothers Émile and Léon Nagant, is a distinctive and powerful weapon with a unique gas-seal system. This seven-shot, double-action revolver is renowned for its ability to maintain a gas-tight seal between the cylinder and the barrel, enhancing muzzle velocity and accuracy. Adopted by the Russian Empire, this revolver features a solid frame, a distinctive reloading gate on the right side, and a folding loading rod. Its robust construction and reliable performance make it a favored sidearm for military and law enforcement, prized for its accuracy and durability.
